com.poesys.db

Class Properties

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.Properties

  • public abstract class Properties
extends java.lang.Object
    Get the properties from the PoesysDbBundle properties file or optionally from user-specified files. These are I18N properties that the application can customize in their own version of the properties file PoesysDbBundle.properties or a custom properties file. The properties class works as a Singleton pattern class that has a list of property files set up when you first access the class.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Method Detail

      • initializePropertiesFiles

        public static void initializePropertiesFiles(java.util.List<java.lang.String> names)
        Initialize the list of property bundles from the supplied names. The list then contains property bundles in the same order as the input names with the default Poesys/DB bundle last in the list. The application should call this method once as a static initializer.
        Parameters:
        names - the property-file names in package format (for example, com.poesys.db.PoesysDbBundle)

      • getProperty

        public static java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.Object[] args)
        Get the property identified by the key string. Expand the property template from the resource bundle with any arguments supplied in an array of object arguments (String, Integer, and so on). This method uses the default locale.
        Parameters:
        key - the key in the resource bundle that identifies the property
        args - an array of object values to substitute in as arguments
        Returns:
        the completed property value

      • getProperty

        public static java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.Object[] args,
                           java.util.Locale locale)
                                    throws java.util.MissingResourceException
        Get the property identified by the key string from the designated locale. Expand the property template from the resource bundles with any arguments supplied in an array of object arguments (String, Integer, and so on). There should be a localized resource bundle for the designated locale; if not, the system uses the default locale. If the message is not a key from the resource bundle, render the property directly as the completed property.
        Parameters:
        key - the key in a resource bundle that identifies the property
        args - an array of object values to substitute in as arguments
        locale - the locale to use to look up the property
        Returns:
        the completed property
        Throws:
        java.util.MissingResourceException - when the method does not find the key in any registered bundle
